text: Effects of <extra_id_0> IL-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> IL-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> on LPS - induced transcription factors ( AP-1 , <extra_id_0> NF-IL6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and NF-kappa B ) which are involved in <extra_id_0> IL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> regulation .

<extra_id_0> Interleukin-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> IL-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) , like <extra_id_0> IL-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , is known to inhibit cytokine expression in activated human monocytes .

We showed that both <extra_id_0> IL-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> IL-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> inhibit LPS - induced <extra_id_0> IL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA and protein expression by inhibiting the transcription rate of the <extra_id_0> IL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene .

The strong inhibition of the <extra_id_0> IL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transcription rate prompted us to study the effect of <extra_id_0> IL-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> IL-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> on the expression of transcription factors .

We questioned whether or not <extra_id_0> IL-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> IL-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> affected the expression of transcription factors that are known to be involved in the control of the <extra_id_0> IL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transcription rate , namely activator protein - 1 ( AP-1 ) , <extra_id_0> nuclear factor IL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> NF-IL6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) , and nuclear factor kappa B ( NF-kappaB ) .

In electrophoretic mobility shift assays ( EMSAs ) we showed that <extra_id_0> IL-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> IL-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> inhibited LPS - induced AP-1 binding activity .
The inhibiting effect of <extra_id_0> IL-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was slightly more pronounced than that of <extra_id_0> IL-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

Downregulation of LPS - induced AP-1 was accompanied , and thus possibly explained , by a reduced expression at mRNA level of the two major components of the AP-1 complex , namely <extra_id_0> c-fos <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> c-jun <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> as determined by Northern experiments .

Binding activity of <extra_id_0> NF-IL6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was also strongly inhibited by <extra_id_0> IL-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> whereas <extra_id_0> IL-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> showed no effect .

<extra_id_0> NF-IL6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA levels were not affected by <extra_id_0> IL-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> or <extra_id_0> IL-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , suggesting that <extra_id_0> IL-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> affects binding activity of preexisting <extra_id_0> NF-IL6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
Neither <extra_id_0> IL-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> nor <extra_id_0> IL-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> inhibited LPS - induced NF-kappa B binding activity .

In agreement with this finding , Northern experiments where <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> p105 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA levels were determined , demonstrated that expression of these components of the NF-kappa B transcription factor were not affected by <extra_id_0> IL-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> or <extra_id_0> IL-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

Furthermore , neither <extra_id_0> IL-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> nor <extra_id_0> IL-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> showed any effect on I-kappa B mRNA expression as determined by Northern experiments .
Thus , <extra_id_0> IL-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> IL-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> similarly affect <extra_id_0> IL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression .

However , for <extra_id_0> IL-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> this was accompanied with a reduction of AP-1 and <extra_id_0> NF-IL6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> binding activity whereas <extra_id_0> IL-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> only inhibited AP-1 binding activity .
